contentrichtext.text: {{BLP self-published|date=October 2012}} {{Infobox person | name = Jayawantiben Mehta | image = Jayawantiben Mehta.jpg | imagesize = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1938|12|20}} | birth_place = [[Aurangabad, Maharashtra]] | residence = Mumbai | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Politician | nationality = Indian | salary = | networth = | yearsactive= | othername = | spouse = | children = | website = | awards = }} '''Jayawantiben Mehta''' (born 20 December 1938) is an [[India]]n politician. She is a member of the [[Bharatiya Janata Party]] (BJP). She was born in [[Aurangabad, Maharashtra|Aurangabad]] in [[Maharashtra]]. She entered politics in 1962 and was elected municipal councillor ([[Mumbai]]) in 1968. Subsequently she was reelected and served as municipal councillor for 10 years. During the Emergency declared in 1975, she was imprisoned for 19 months. In 1978, she was elected to the Maharashtra legislative assembly and served 2 terms up to 1985. In 1980, she was made a member of the national executive of the BJP and in 1988, she was made the All India Secretary. In 1989, she was first elected to the [[Lok Sabha]]. She was subsequently reelected in 1996 and 1999 and was made a Minister of Power in the [[Vajpayee]] Government. She served as President of Mahila Morcha of BJP (1991–1995) and as Vice President of BJP (1993–1995). She represented the [[Mumbai South (Lok Sabha Constituency)|Mumbai South]] constituency in the 11th and 13th Lok Sabha in 1996 and 1999. ==External links== * [http://www.jayawantiben.com Her website] ==Notes== <references/> {{NDA_candidates_for_2004_elections_to_the_Lok_Sabha_from_Mumbai}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Mehta, Jayawantiben | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Indian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 20 December 1938 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mehta, Jayawantiben}} [[Category:1938 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:11th Lok Sabha members]] [[Category:13th Lok Sabha members]] [[Category:Bharatiya Janata Party politicians]] [[Category:Indian prisoners and detainees]] [[Category:Indian women in politics]] [[Category:Maharashtra MLAs 1978–1980]] [[Category:Maharashtra MLAs 1980–1985]] [[Category:Maharashtra politicians]] [[Category:Members of Parliament from Maharashtra]]
